result.title: Community-driven care: a draft
result.description: "A draft explicit social contract for community-driven care services design, aimed at removing exploitation from the participatory design picture. This is done by styling the community as a collective author and researcher, rather than a ""rightless volunteer"", like in most crowdsourcing exercises."

result.description: Web services for classifying the relevance and informativeness of social media and SMS messages will be made accessible for this deliverable. result.title: 1.2 Training kit
result.description: The training kit consists of a definition of the ambition and goals. Furthermore, it describes the process, supported by formats, of participatory design process in open source healthcare solutions. Do's and Don'ts are included, lessons learned and best practices shared. Depending on the specific context of the target group, this kit can be adjusted. It will be openly downloadable from the Made4You website.

result.title: Impact assessment of technological and regulatory innovations
result.description: The report provides an assessment of the implications of different technology scenarios (e.g. vary/adjust parameters on for example landing dynamics, productivity growth due to technological change) and institutional improvements. Suggestions for these issues will be developed in work packages 2, 3 and 4. The report is based on the enhanced SUCCESS scenario toolbox developed in work package 1.

result.title: Recommendation for the development of strategies and policies for EU fishing industry and aquaculture
result.description: The report compiles and synthesises the results of the various SUCCESS case studies and value-chain analyses with the objective to gain insight in the best practices of innovations in production processes and the value chain from production to consumption. Based on an updated SWOT analysis, the report provides recommendations in terms of development strategies and public policies.

result.description: The repports prÃ©sents the medothology used to assess the impact of various scenarios on the economic competitiveness of the European fishery and aquaculture sectors, in terms of growth, jobs and innovation.
